title: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on air in Plymouth Monday morning, and freaked out
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on The Weather Channel from Plymouth on Monday morning.
The Weather Channel meteorologist is known for his enthusiasm for thundersnow, experiencing it previously in Plymouth in 2015.
Cantore's presence in Plymouth on Sunday signaled locals to prepare for the February storm.

title: Nearly 1,000 flights cancelled at Logan Airport due to nor’easter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Nearly 1,000 flights at Logan Airport were canceled Monday due to a powerful nor’easter affecting Massachusetts.
Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency as the storm brings up to 24 inches of snow and 70 mph winds.
JetBlue and other airlines are waiving change fees through February 26, advising passengers to confirm flight statuses before traveling.

title: Map: Here’s where power outages are being reported in Mass., R.I., N.H.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Over 113,000 in Massachusetts, 14,000 in Rhode Island, and nearly 200 in New Hampshire face power outages.
High winds and 18-24 inches of snow predicted to cause significant power outages in New England.
Cape and Islands severely impacted by 70 mph winds and intense snow, causing major power disruptions.

title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A pig leg or flank was found near Flowed Meadow at the Cove in Auburndale Park, Newton.
Newton police are investigating the incident alongside Newton Animal Control and Mass. Environmental Police.
Massachusetts law prohibits hunting or harming wildlife on conservation land or park properties, including Newton parks.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points despite inefficient shooting in a 111-89 win over the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard scored 30 points off the bench, continuing his strong performance for the Celtics.
LeBron James praised Jaylen Brown post-game, mentioning their respectful relationship despite past comments about Bronny.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts announced closures for Monday, Feb. 23 due to a major snowstorm.
Major cities affected by school closures include Boston, Cambridge, Lowell, and Worcester as snowstorm impacts the area.
Residents can report missed closures by emailing [email protected] for updates on school status.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police are searching for Kyron Simmons, 36, accused of shooting and killing a dog on February 3.
Simmons faces multiple charges including home invasion, discharge of a firearm, and reckless endangerment of a child.
An arrest warrant was issued for Simmons, who is considered armed and dangerous, following evidence from security footage.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control reported a bobcat sighting near Deerpath Road and Route 109 last week.
Residents are advised not to approach wildlife and to eliminate outdoor food sources.
Spring is bobcat mating season, increasing their visibility in human-populated areas.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora previews the Red Sox 2026 lineup with Roman Anthony as leadoff hitter and Trevor Story batting second.
Anthony had a strong finish in 2025, batting .336 with six home runs in 27 games as leadoff hitter.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa is favored over Marcelo Mayer for Opening Day, despite Mayer's prospect status and infield potential.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar and Heather Alterisio
bullets: Governor Maura Healey warns residents to stay off roads as nor'easter brings up to 2 feet of snow and high winds.
Over 113,000 Massachusetts residents face power outages as winds reach over 70 mph, severely impacting Cape and the Islands.
Boston declares snow emergency; MBTA alters schedules and DoorDash pauses operations amid the storm's impact.
